Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a red-brown pottery vessel with convex sides and slightly everted and short neck, the fabric is grey in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393427) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393427)
